text: Murray Olderman (March 27, 1922 â€“ June 10, 2020) was an American sports cartoonist and writer.Horgan, Richard. "SO WHAT DO YOU DO, MURRAY OLDERMAN, ICONIC SPORTS JOURNALIST AND CARTOONIST?," Media Bistro (May 21, 2014). His art was used by the Pro Football Hall of Fame and hung above the Hall of Fame statues. The Hall of Fame made all of the artwork digital so that visitors to the hall can see them through electronic kiosks. He was born in New York City. Olderman died on June 10, 2020 in Rancho Mirage, California from a heart attack, aged 98.Murray Olderman, Who Both Wrote and Drew About Sports, Dies at 98 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:American cartoonists Category:1922 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Writers from New York City
title: Murray Olderman
